articles.headline: A Conservative Magazine May Pay a Price for Being Unfriendly to Trump
articles.snippet: The Weekly Standard is facing the consequences of doing independent journalism in an increasingly partisan environment.
articles.abstract: The Weekly Standard is facing the consequences of doing independent journalism in an increasingly partisan environment.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Weekly Standard didn’t go along, and now its future is in danger.

articles.headline: In Funeral of Pomp and Pageantry, Nation Bids Farewell to George Bush
articles.snippet: The 41st president was remembered as a “kinder and gentler” leader who stood in contrast to the politics of insults now in vogue.
articles.abstract: The 41st president was remembered as a “kinder and gentler” leader who stood in contrast to the politics of insults now in vogue.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The nation bade farewell on Wednesday to George Herbert Walker Bush, the patriarch of one of the most consequential political dynasties of modern times and the president who presided over the end of the Cold War and the beginning of a new era of American dominance in the world.

articles.headline: Uber’s Self-Driving Cars Are Set to Return in a Downsized Test
articles.snippet: Eight months after a fatal crash, the vehicles are expected to be back on Pittsburgh streets within a few weeks, but safety questions remain.
articles.abstract: Eight months after a fatal crash, the vehicles are expected to be back on Pittsburgh streets within a few weeks, but safety questions remain.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Eight months after one of Uber’s self-driving cars struck and killed a pedestrian, the ride-hailing company is close to putting its autonomous vehicles back on the road in a drastically reduced version of earlier efforts.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Kate Conger

articles.headline: Huawei C.F.O. Is Arrested in Canada for Extradition to the U.S.
articles.snippet: The detention of Meng Wanzhou is likely to escalate tensions between the United States and China just as their trade tensions had begun to thaw.
articles.abstract: The detention of Meng Wanzhou is likely to escalate tensions between the United States and China just as their trade tensions had begun to thaw.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A top executive and daughter of the founder of the Chinese tech giant Huawei was arrested on Saturday in Canada at the request of the United States, in a move likely to escalate tensions between the two countries at a delicate moment.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: Facebook Emails Show Its Real Mission: Making Money and Crushing Competition
articles.snippet: Messages released publicly on Wednesday suggest the idealistic image the company promoted for years was a carefully cultivated smoke screen.
articles.abstract: Messages released publicly on Wednesday suggest the idealistic image the company promoted for years was a carefully cultivated smoke screen.
articles.lead_paragraph: British lawmakers on Wednesday gave a gift to every Facebook critic who has argued that the company, while branding itself as a do-gooder enterprise, has actually been acting much like any other profit-seeking behemoth.

articles.headline: ‘Already an Exception’: Merkel’s Legacy Is Shaped by Migration and Austerity
articles.snippet: As the German chancellor’s party chooses a new leader, the values she embodies are in danger. Some ask whether her choices helped plant the seeds of the forces now tearing Europe apart.
articles.abstract: As the German chancellor’s party chooses a new leader, the values she embodies are in danger. Some ask whether her choices helped plant the seeds of the forces now tearing Europe apart.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHEMNITZ, Germany — Two weeks after announcing that she would not seek another term, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany was standing in an old locomotive factory in the eastern city of Chemnitz, the scene of far-right protests this year.

articles.headline: Elizabeth Warren Stands by DNA Test. But Around Her, Worries Abound.
articles.snippet: Since releasing the results in October, the ancestry issue clouding her possible presidential campaign has only intensified.
articles.abstract: Since releasing the results in October, the ancestry issue clouding her possible presidential campaign has only intensified.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The plan was straightforward: After years of being challenged by President Trump and others about a decades-old claim of Native American ancestry, Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts would take a DNA test to prove her stated family origins in the Cherokee and Delaware tribes.

articles.headline: Toxic Smoke Is Africa’s Quiet Killer. An Entrepreneur Says His Fix Can Make a Fortune
articles.snippet: Eric Reynolds is betting his wood-pellet stove — and his company’s distribution system — can make billions by rescuing some of the poorest people on earth from toxic smoke.
articles.abstract: Eric Reynolds is betting his wood-pellet stove — and his company’s distribution system — can make billions by rescuing some of the poorest people on earth from toxic smoke.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eric Reynolds will tell you that he is on the verge of freeing much of humanity from the deadly scourge of the cooking fire. He can halt the toxic smoke wafting through African homes, protect what is left of the continent’s forest cover and help rescue the planet from the wrath of climate change.

articles.headline: Arrest Shakes Huawei as Global Skepticism of Its Business Grows
articles.snippet: Britain, New Zealand, Australia and other countries have grown increasingly worried about potential security risks related to the Chinese telecom giant.
articles.abstract: Britain, New Zealand, Australia and other countries have grown increasingly worried about potential security risks related to the Chinese telecom giant.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is one of China’s proudest corporate success stories, a colossus in cutting-edge technology that elbowed out Western rivals to become the biggest supplier of the hardware that connects our modern world.
articles.byline: By Raymond Zhong and Li Yuan
